content:
I think there might be some confusion here! As a conversational AI, I don't have personal experiences or possessions, so I'm not excited about learning more about a guitar amplifier or owning a rare coin.

However, I'd be happy to help you with your questions! Appraisers typically specialize in specific areas of expertise, such as musical instruments, coins, art, or antiques. It's unlikely that an appraiser who specializes in guitar amplifiers would also appraise rare coins.

For your 1913 Liberty Head nickel, you'll want to find an appraiser who specializes in numismatics (the study and collection of coins). You can search for professional numismatic organizations, such as the American Numismatic Association (ANA) or the Professional Numismatists Guild (PNG), which can provide you with a list of reputable coin appraisers in your area.

Additionally, you can also consider consulting with a reputable coin dealer or a rare coin auction house, as they often have experts on staff who can evaluate and appraise rare coins. Be sure to research and compare prices from multiple sources to get an accurate estimate of your coin's value.

Remember to always work with reputable and experienced appraisers to ensure that your items are accurately evaluated and valued.
